Articles.Content: The Defender was built by Veto Aerospace as a means of deploying VA\'s Avia ballistic missiles from space, in answer to a missing place in its own range of launch platforms. This series includes the Gannet, Albatross and the prototype Kittiwake. Also in development is the Defender\'s sister station, the Tiger Strike, which will carry the more advanced Avia variant Hawk guided missile, which will carry a remote CAC module to send it exactly on target. The Tiger Strike will be carrying some scientific equipment to balance for the unneeded command capsule.
How do you deploy and launch the missiles? I have been trying to work on a mirv design but even putting engine and decoupler on the same stage, they just hiss at me and then detach all sulkily.
hello,i\'m kinda new to ksp i was wondering where did you get those mods? =P

hello,i\'m kinda new to ksp i was wondering where did you get those mods? =P

The capsule, nosecone, and cone-shaped adaptor thingy are from the Novapunch pack; the missiles are from JellyCubes\' parts pack; the solar panels, antennae and box thingies are from the Probodobodyne pack; the yellow tank is part of NovaSilisko\'s lunar lander; the fins are from C7\'s flight pack; and I\'ve no idea about the rest of it.

The capsule, nosecone, and cone-shaped adaptor thingy are from the Novapunch pack; the missiles are from JellyCubes\' parts pack; the solar panels, antennae and box thingies are from the Probodobodyne pack; the yellow tank is part of NovaSilisko\'s lunar lander; the fins are from C7\'s flight pack; and I\'ve no idea about the rest of it.

Thanks Kryten.

And with the missiles, I used Jellycube\'s Wasps because they can fire even after undocking. With the Avia still attatched to the launch platform, unlike the spaceplane carriers of the missile, having the Wasps fire before undocking the missile tears it apart.
